snippet: President Obama will call for a one-year break only for people making less than $250,000, a limit opposed by Republicans and at odds with a higher cap favored by some Democrats.
abstract: President Obama will call for a one-year extension of the Bush-era tax cuts for people making less than $250,000, a limit opposed by Republicans and at odds with a higher cap favored by some Democrats; by calling for an extension for just a year, he hopes to make Republicans look obstructionist and unreasonable and deepen the contrast with his challenger, Mitt Romney.
lead_paragraph: President Obama will call for a one-year break only for people making less than $250,000, a limit opposed by Republicans and at odds with a higher cap favored by some Democrats.

headline.seo: Obama Seeks 2013 Tax Cuts Within Limits
headline.main: Obama Poised for New Fight With G.O.P. Over Tax Cuts
headline.print_headline: Obama Poised For New Fight Over Tax Cuts
